channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large, long potholes and gaps between carriage surface joins, 11th January
item.description:
Where two (parallel) lanes of road surface have been paid, large gaps are present. Considering this is a 40mph road, and a roundabout, it is very dangerous for motorcycles and car drivers alike. There are several of these long, deep gaps between the lanes on this part of the roundabout (exit of Eastern Way and Carlyle Road). Another, smaller pothole (https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/8620245) was fixed within weeks of it appearing.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Byron Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle has been parked for many months and is untaxed, 11th January
item.description:

item.title: Mot Expired, 11th January
item.description:
"We would like to report a vehicle that appears to have been abandoned in our local car park. The car’s MOT expired over a year and eight months ago, and it has remained stationary in the same spot for some time, taking up valuable space that could be used by other drivers. Could someone please arrange for an assessment of the vehicle and, if appropriate, arrange for its removal in line with relevant procedures? We would be grateful for your support in resolving this matter."

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sarre Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car Taking Space, 11th January
item.description:
"I wanted to bring to your attention a vehicle that has been parked in the car park for several months now – from what I can tell, it has remained in the same spot without being moved or used for at least three months. While I understand that car parks are intended for legitimate use by those who need them, this particular car is taking up a valuable parking space that could otherwise be used by residents, visitors, or people accessing local facilities. It appears to be unoccupied for extended periods, with no visible signs of recent use such as clean windshields, fresh tire marks, or updated parking permits. Given the limited number of spaces available in this area, the presence of this stationary vehicle is becoming increasingly inconvenient for others who rely on the car park on a regular basis. Would it be possible to arrange for it to be assessed and, if appropriate, removed in accordance with local regulations or car park management policies? I would be grateful for your assistance in addressing this matter."

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sarre Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 11th January
item.description:

item.description:
